intro: Racosperma longipedunculatum, commonly known as the long-pedunculate acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval leaflets and produces yellow flowers in dense, drooping clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various native animals.
